mpls_schema.description: Specifies the multi-protocol label switching protocol.

global.description: Configure the multi-protocol label switching protocol global attributes.

lsr-id.description: MPLS LSR ID. If the MPLS LSR ID uses the primary IP address of the loopback interface, the loopback interface cannot be deleted.

null-lable-type.description: Specifies a null label type. 1. Implicit null label: This type of labels can be popped by using the Penultimate Hop Popping (PHP) feature. The end node assigns an implicit null label 3 to the penultimate node. 2. Explicit null label: This type of labels cannot be popped by using the PHP feature. The end node assigns the explicit null label 0 to the penultimate node. 3. Null label unsupported: The PHP feature cannot be used to pop a label. The end node assigns a non-null label whose value is equal to or larger than 16 to the penultimate node.

diff-serv-mode.description: Specifies the diffserv mode for MPLS.

sr-exp-mode.description: Specifies the EXP mode for SR. The value can be pipe or uniform.

te-ttl-mode.description: Specifies the TTL mode for RSVP TE.

ldp-ttl-mode.description: Specifies the TTL mode for LDP.

ftn-delay-time.description: Specifies the FEC to NHLFE tunnel delay time.

bit-err-levels.description: List of the config for bit error level information.

cross-connect.description: Operational data of a cross connection.

ilm-label-stacks.description: List of incoming label map (ILM) label stacks.

ilm-label-stack.description: Operational data of incoming label map (ILM) label stack.

out-label.description: Outgoing label. The name is case-insensitive.

ingress-lsp.description: Specifies the number of LSPs whose ingresses are the local node.

egress-lsp.description: Specifies the number of LSPs whose egresses are the local node.

transit-lsp.description: Specifies the number of LSPs whose transit nodes are the local node.

total-lsp.description: Specifies the total number of LSPs.

cir.description: Specify the Session CAR CIR value.

cbs.description: Specify the Session CAR CBS value.

pir.description: Specify the Session CAR PIR value.

pbs.description: Specify the Session CAR PBS value.

cir.description: Specify the Session CAR CIR value.

cbs.description: Specify the Session CAR CBS value.

pir.description: Specify the Session CAR PIR value.

pbs.description: Specify the Session CAR PBS value.

global.description: Configure global MPLS TE basic parameters.

switch-delay-time.description: Delay time for switching the TE traffic from a Primary CR-LSP to a Modified CR-LSP.

delete-delay-time.description: Delay time for deleting the Primary CR-LSP after the TE traffic is switched to the Modified CR-LSP.

frr-timer-weight.description: FRR binding upgrade weight. If the value is 0, stop the FRR timer. The FRR timer interval depends on the value and the number of LSPs.

frr-switch-delay-time.description: When hot-standby and frr exist at the same time, delay time for switching the TE traffic from a Primary CR-LSP to FRR.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

path-selection.description: Enable path selection and set mode as overload.

rsvp-entropy-label.description: Enable/disable RSVP P2P tunnel entropy label.

suppress-flapping-disable.description: Enable/disable the TE LSP flapping suppression.

path-verification.description: Enable/disable MPLS TE tunnel path verify.

explicit-path-deletion-down.description: Enable/disable SR LSP explicit path deletion down.

self-ping-duration.description: Global self-ping timeout period. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

auto-frr-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable the enabling state of auto bypass reoptimization.

auto-frr-frequency.description: Specifies the frequency of auto bypass reoptimization.

auto-bandwidth-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel's traffic rate sampling switch.

auto-bandwidth-interval.description: Set interval of Tunnel traffic rate sampling.

flood-bandwidth-enable.description: Enable/disable flooding TE link bandwidth periodically capability. When TE LSP reserves or releases bandwidth with the changing rate not reaching the flooding threshold of TE link, it will not flood bandwidth to network. In order to flood bandwidth to network as soon as possible, and to avoid waste of network resource caused by frequent flooding, it will flood changed bandwidth to network periodically.

flood-bandwidth-interval.description: Interval at which a TE interface floods bandwidth over the network. The bandwidth that a TE LSP reserves or releases on an interface may be only a small part compared with the reservable bandwidth of the interface, which does not reach the flooding threshold of the interface. To flood the interface bandwidth over the network and avoid frequent flooding, the TE NE is configured to flood bandwidth over the network periodically.

name.description: Specifies the name of a TE tunnel interface. The name is case-insensitive.

max-hello-miss-times.description: Maximum number of Hello packet loss times. When the number of Hello packet refreshing (from the NE) times exceeds the configured maximum number, and the NE does not receive a response from its peer end, the NE considers that the session with the peer end is lost.

hello-interval.description: Interval for refreshing Hello packets. It is the interval of refreshing a Hello packet from an NE to its peer after a Hello session is established.

keep-multiplier.description: Timeout multiplier of soft state PSB or RSB. If the local NE does not receive a packet for refreshing the TE LSP soft state from its upstream or downstream neighbor in the period (that is a specified multiplier of the refreshing cycle), the NE considers that the soft state times out and will delete the TE LSP.

refresh-interval.description: Cycle of refreshing a PATH or a RESV message (for soft state maintenance).

resv-confirm-enable.description: Enable/disable reservation confirmation capability. After the reservation confirmation capability is configured on a NE, all starting nodes of TE tunnels whose destinations are the NE will send source reservation confirmation messages to the NE after receiving the RESV messages from the NE. This capability is not applicable for single-direction LSPs. Enabling reservation confirmation capability in the single-direction LSP scenario is not recommended.

retransmission-interval.description: Interval at which interface summary messages are retransmitted.

retransmission-increment-value.description: Incremental value for retransmitting interface summary. If a NE does not receive a response from the peer end after sending a message to the peer end, the NE will start the retransmission mechanism. The retransmission interval increases with the increase of the retransmission incremental value. The formula is as following: retransmission interval = last retransmission interval * (1 + retransmission incremental value).

challenge-retransmission-interval.description: Challenge message retransmission interval. If the NE does not receive a response message from the peer end after sending a Challenge message for handshake authentication to the peer end, the NE will retransmit the Challenge message.

max-challenge-miss-times.description: Maximum challenge loss times. If the times of a retransmitting a Challenge message from the NE to its neighbor exceed the maximum challenge loss times, the NE considers that the handshake cannot be established and will not send a Challenge message again.

is-send-down-reason.description: Enable/disable RSVP send down reason capability. When this command is configured on a non-ingress node, RSVP can send the down reasons to the ingress through PATH ERROR message and RESV TEAR message.

transit-rro1.description:
Transit-rro1.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value cannot be set to disable for transit-rro1. If transit-rro1 is configured, one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type can only be selected form transit RRO types. The transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

transit-rro2.description:
Transit-rro2.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The value if disable type can be disable. For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. If transit-rro2 is configured, this leaf can be set to disable. Or one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type form transit RRO types can only be selected for transit-rro2 node, and the transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

transit-rro3.description:
Transit-rro3.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The value if disable type can be disable. For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. If transit-rro2 is set to disable, transit-rro3 can only be set to disable, too. Or one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type can only be selected for transit-rro3 node form transit RRO types, and the transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

egress-rro1.description:
Egress-rro1.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For egress RRO types: For egress RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value if disable type can be disable. The value cannot be set to disable for egress-rro1. If egress-rro1 is delivered, either the inbound interface type or Router ID type can be selected form egress RRO types. The egress RRO type of egress-rro1 must be differ from that of egress-rro2.

egress-rro2.description:
Egress-rro2.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For egress RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value if disable type can be disable. If egress-rro2 is configured, this leaf can be set to disable. Or either the inbound interface type or Router ID type can be selected form egress RRO types, and the egress RRO type of egress-rro1 must be differ from that of egress-rro2.

frr-bw-compatible.description: Enable/disable fast-reroute bandwidth storage in memory, and the default mode is float.

without-affinity.description: Enable/disable the session-attribute object in RSVP message without affinity at ingress.

graceful-shutdown-time.description: Delayed deletion period of Graceful Shutdown.

items.description: Configure a list of establishes hello sessions with a single-hop or multi-hop neighbor of a specified IP address.

peer-infos.description: List of MPLS RSVP-TE neighbor information.

peer-info.description: Operational state of MPLS RSVP-TE neighbor query information.

local-interface-name.description: Local interface name for normal neighbor.

neighbor-src-instance.description: Neighbor src instance of a neighbor.

hello-type-sent.description: Hello type sent of a neighbor.

srefresh-enable.description: Srefresh enable state of a neighbor.

authentication-enable.description: Authentication enable state of a neighbor.

last-valid-sequence-h.description: Upper 32 bits of last valid sequence number.

last-valid-sequence-l.description: Lower 32 bits of last valid sequence number.

authentication.description: Configure neighbor configuration of RSVP TE authentication.

type.description: Authentication type on a RSVP-TE neighbor.

keychain-name.description: Keychain name. The name is case insensitive.

md5-password.description: Authentication key of a RSVP TE neighbor. The two NEs that configured with neighbor authentication authenticate each other by sending and receiving RSVP packets. The packets that are sent from the local NE to its neighbor carry the authentication information that are calculated based on the authentication key by using the MD5 algorithm. The packets received from the neighbor are also authenticated based on the authentication key. The password is a string ranging from 1 to 255 characters for a simple text key and 20 to 432 characters for a cipher text key.

life-time.description: Authentication lifetime. During the authentication lifetime, RSVP authentication lifetime will be reset after a RSVP packet is received. If no RSVP packet is received when the authentication lifetime times out, the RSVP neighbor will delete the authentication relationship to prevent persistent authentication.

handshake-enable.description: Enable/disable the handshake authentication. When RSVP packet authentication is out of order, a handshake will be initiated and authentication will be re-negotiated.

window-size.description: Size of an authentication window that is set to prevent information loss caused by packet disorder. If the packet sequence number exceeds the window size, the packet is considered to be out of order.

os-group-name.description: Name of RSVP distributed instance os-group.

bfd-all-interfaces.description: Configure BFD for all interfaces parameters.

enable.description: Enable/disable the enabling state of bfd for all interfaces capability.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval for sending BFD packets for all interfaces.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval for receiving BFD packets for all interfaces.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing global MPLS TE BFD for all interfaces packets.

tos-exp.description: Configure the priority of the global BFD session packet.

preferred-igp.description: Preferred IGP TEDB in CSPF to calculate path.

multi-instances-short-path-mode.description: Multiple IGP instances shortest path Mode.

tie-breaking.description:
Rules for selecting multiple equal-cost routes. In path computation, if multiple paths meet constraints, a device uses this rule to select a path.
Random: randomly selects a path.
Least Fill: selects a link with the lowest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.
Most Fill: selects a link with the highest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options IGP and TE, default is TE.

srlg-path-calculate-mode.description:
SRLG path calculation mode. It is configured on the ingress of a tunnel so that a TE HSB path can be calculated based on the SRLG if TE HSB is enabled.
In strict mode, the ingress keeps using the SRLG as a constraint. In preferred mode, SRLG will be considered as a constraint only when the ingress computes a backup CR-LSP at the first time. If the path computation fails, the ingress will no longer uses the SRLG as a constraint.

tedbs.description: List of TEDB records of MPLS-TE.

tedb.description: Statistics of TEDB record of MPLS-TE.

process-id.description: Process ID of the IGP protocol.

area-id.description: ID of the area where the node resides.

link-count.description: Number of TE interfaces of the node.

srdbs.description: List of SRDB records of MPLS-TE.

srdb.description: Statistics of SRDB record of MPLS-TE.

process-id.description: Process ID of the IGP protocol.

area-id.description: ID of the area where the node resides.

p2mp-leaf-lists.description: List of p2mp leaf list configuration.

name.description: Name of leaf list of P2mp.

explicit-path-name.description: Explicit path name of a leaflist. The name is case-insensitive.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a P2MP Template setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a P2MP Template holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization of P2MP Template.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a P2MP Template with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

include-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (includeAny).

exclude-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (excludeAny).

include-all.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (includeAll).

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

frr.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of P2MP Template.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbit/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the priority. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

bfd.description: Configure dynamic BFD for TE LSP parameter of P2MP template.

enable.description: Enable/disable BFD for TE LSP enabling state.

min-tx-interval.description: BFD sending interval.

min-rx-interval.description: BFD receiving interval.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of BFD loss times. When BFD for TE LSP is enabled for a TE tunnel, a BFD session can be set up. If the number of lost BFD messages exceeds the maximum number of BFD loss times, the TE tunnel is considered to be faulty.

record-route.description: Route record mode. The available options are not record, recording routes only, and recording routes and labels.

resv-style.description: P2P Template reservation styles. SE style: shared explicit style; FF: fixed filter style. The default tunnel reservation style is SE.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a P2P Template setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a P2P Template holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of P2P Template.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a P2P Template with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

auto-bandwidth-threshold.description: Set the threshold of the adjustment bandwidth.

auto-bandwidth-threshold-absolute.description: Set the absolute minimum bandwidth of the adjustment bandwidth.

hotstandby-enable.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

hotstandby-wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

hotstandby-path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

frr.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of P2P Template.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

bandwidth.description: FRR-protection bandwidth (kbits/s) requested by an active tunnel. The value cannot exceed the bandwidth of the active tunnel.

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the priority. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

path-type.description: Set LSP type. Only support primary type.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

include-all.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (includeAll).

include-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (includeAny).

exclude-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (excludeAny).

items.description: Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include any.
Configure affinity name that can be refer to a tunnel to include all.
Configure tunnel path affinity attribute: Exclude.

bfd.description: Configure dynamic BFD for TE LSP parameter of P2P template.

enable.description:
Enable/disable BFD for TE LSP enabling state.
Special explanation:
Constraint: This capability depends on the configuration of global bfd.

min-tx-interval.description: BFD sending interval.

min-rx-interval.description: BFD receiving interval.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of BFD loss times. When BFD for TE LSP is enabled for a TE tunnel, a BFD session can be set up. If the number of lost BFD messages exceeds the maximum number of BFD loss times, the TE tunnel is considered to be faulty.

ip-prefixs.description: List of IP prefix auto tunnel.

name.description: Ip prefix name of ip prefix auto tunnel.

template-name.description: Template name of ip prefix auto tunnel.

te-class-mode.description: TE-Class only configured from te-class0 to te-class7.

backup-type.description: Backup type of a tunnel association group.

tunnel-statistic.description: Statistics of tunnel about quantities and status.

ingress-tunnel.description: Number of tunnels of the ingress.

ingress-tunnel-up.description: Number of up tunnels of the ingress.

ingress-cr-lsps-up.description: Number of up CR-LSPs of the ingress.

ingress-tunnel-modified.description: Number of modified tunnels of the ingress.

ingress-tunnel-in-progress.description: Number of being-created tunnels of the ingress.

ingress-tunnel-failed.description: Number of down tunnels of the ingress.

transit-tunnel-up.description: Number of up tunnels of the transit node.

egress-tunnel-up.description: Number of up tunnels of the egress.

stitch-label-stacks.description: List of stitch label stacks of the tunnel.

stitch-label-stack.description: Operational data of stitch label stack.

is-local-reserved.description: Indicate that the stitch label is local reserve.

c-hops.description: List of path calculated by stitch label stack.

c-hop.description: Operational data of path calculated by stitch label stack.

index.description: Hop index calculated by stitch label.

type.description: Hop type calculated by stitch label. The available options are strict and loose.

label.description: Hop label calculated by stitch label.

enable.description:
Enable/disable capability of global MPLS TE BFD detection.
Special explanation:
Constraint: This capability depends on the configuration of global bfd.

mode.description:
BFD detect mode.
Special explanation:
In one-arm BFD, the configured min-tx-interval does not take effect.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval for sending Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval for receiving Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

bfd-for-tunnel.description: Configure global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel.

mode.description:
BFD detect mode.
Special explanation:
In one-arm BFD, the configured min-tx-interval does not take effect.
Once mode one-arm-echo is configured, BFD for tunnel is enabled.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are received.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel packets.

bfd-sessions.description: List of statistics all dynamic BFD sessions for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

bfd-session.description: Statistics of a dynamic BFD session for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

outgoing-interface-name.description: Outgoing interface name of the tunnel.

lsp-index.description: LSP index of the BFD session.

signal-protocol.description: Signal protocol type of the tunnel.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are received.

bfd-state.description: Status of dynamic BFD for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

session-age.description: Time elapsed since a BFD session was established.

ilm-label-stack.description: Operational data of incoming label map (ILM) label stack.

out-label.description: Outgoing label. The name is case-insensitive.

egress-lsp.description: Specifies the number of LSPs whose egresses are the local node.

transit-rro1.description:
Transit-rro1.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value cannot be set to disable for transit-rro1. If transit-rro1 is configured, one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type can only be selected form transit RRO types. The transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

Transit-rro2.

Egress-rro1.

global.description: Configure global MPLS TE basic parameters.

switch-delay-time.description: Delay time for switching the TE traffic from a Primary CR-LSP to a Modified CR-LSP.

delete-delay-time.description: Delay time for deleting the Primary CR-LSP after the TE traffic is switched to the Modified CR-LSP.

frr-timer-weight.description: FRR binding upgrade weight. If the value is 0, stop the FRR timer. The FRR timer interval depends on the value and the number of LSPs.

frr-switch-delay-time.description: When hot-standby and frr exist at the same time, delay time for switching the TE traffic from a Primary CR-LSP to FRR.

pce-delegate.description: Specifies the enabling state of PCE delegation capability.

path-selection.description: Enable path selection and set mode as overload.

rsvp-entropy-label.description: Enable/disable RSVP P2P tunnel entropy label.

suppress-flapping-disable.description: Enable/disable the TE LSP flapping suppression.

path-verification.description: Enable/disable MPLS TE tunnel path verify.

explicit-path-deletion-down.description: Enable/disable SR LSP explicit path deletion down.

self-ping-duration.description: Global self-ping timeout period. Value 65535 indicates no limit on the detection time.

auto-frr-reoptimization.description: Enable/disable the enabling state of auto bypass reoptimization.

auto-frr-frequency.description: Specifies the frequency of auto bypass reoptimization.

auto-bandwidth-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel's traffic rate sampling switch.

auto-bandwidth-interval.description: Set interval of Tunnel traffic rate sampling.

flood-bandwidth-enable.description: Enable/disable flooding TE link bandwidth periodically capability. When TE LSP reserves or releases bandwidth with the changing rate not reaching the flooding threshold of TE link, it will not flood bandwidth to network. In order to flood bandwidth to network as soon as possible, and to avoid waste of network resource caused by frequent flooding, it will flood changed bandwidth to network periodically.

flood-bandwidth-interval.description: Interval at which a TE interface floods bandwidth over the network. The bandwidth that a TE LSP reserves or releases on an interface may be only a small part compared with the reservable bandwidth of the interface, which does not reach the flooding threshold of the interface. To flood the interface bandwidth over the network and avoid frequent flooding, the TE NE is configured to flood bandwidth over the network periodically.

name.description: Specifies the name of a TE tunnel interface. The name is case-insensitive.

max-hello-miss-times.description: Maximum number of Hello packet loss times. When the number of Hello packet refreshing (from the NE) times exceeds the configured maximum number, and the NE does not receive a response from its peer end, the NE considers that the session with the peer end is lost.

hello-interval.description: Interval for refreshing Hello packets. It is the interval of refreshing a Hello packet from an NE to its peer after a Hello session is established.

keep-multiplier.description: Timeout multiplier of soft state PSB or RSB. If the local NE does not receive a packet for refreshing the TE LSP soft state from its upstream or downstream neighbor in the period (that is a specified multiplier of the refreshing cycle), the NE considers that the soft state times out and will delete the TE LSP.

refresh-interval.description: Cycle of refreshing a PATH or a RESV message (for soft state maintenance).

resv-confirm-enable.description: Enable/disable reservation confirmation capability. After the reservation confirmation capability is configured on a NE, all starting nodes of TE tunnels whose destinations are the NE will send source reservation confirmation messages to the NE after receiving the RESV messages from the NE. This capability is not applicable for single-direction LSPs. Enabling reservation confirmation capability in the single-direction LSP scenario is not recommended.

retransmission-interval.description: Interval at which interface summary messages are retransmitted.

retransmission-increment-value.description: Incremental value for retransmitting interface summary. If a NE does not receive a response from the peer end after sending a message to the peer end, the NE will start the retransmission mechanism. The retransmission interval increases with the increase of the retransmission incremental value. The formula is as following: retransmission interval = last retransmission interval * (1 + retransmission incremental value).

challenge-retransmission-interval.description: Challenge message retransmission interval. If the NE does not receive a response message from the peer end after sending a Challenge message for handshake authentication to the peer end, the NE will retransmit the Challenge message.

max-challenge-miss-times.description: Maximum challenge loss times. If the times of a retransmitting a Challenge message from the NE to its neighbor exceed the maximum challenge loss times, the NE considers that the handshake cannot be established and will not send a Challenge message again.

is-send-down-reason.description: Enable/disable RSVP send down reason capability. When this command is configured on a non-ingress node, RSVP can send the down reasons to the ingress through PATH ERROR message and RESV TEAR message.

peer-info.description: Operational state of MPLS RSVP-TE neighbor query information.

local-interface-name.description: Local interface name for normal neighbor.

neighbor-src-instance.description: Neighbor src instance of a neighbor.

hello-type-sent.description: Hello type sent of a neighbor.

srefresh-enable.description: Srefresh enable state of a neighbor.

authentication-enable.description: Authentication enable state of a neighbor.

last-valid-sequence-h.description: Upper 32 bits of last valid sequence number.

last-valid-sequence-l.description: Lower 32 bits of last valid sequence number.

authentication.description: Configure neighbor configuration of RSVP TE authentication.

type.description: Authentication type on a RSVP-TE neighbor.

keychain-name.description: Keychain name. The name is case insensitive.

md5-password.description: Authentication key of a RSVP TE neighbor. The two NEs that configured with neighbor authentication authenticate each other by sending and receiving RSVP packets. The packets that are sent from the local NE to its neighbor carry the authentication information that are calculated based on the authentication key by using the MD5 algorithm. The packets received from the neighbor are also authenticated based on the authentication key. The password is a string ranging from 1 to 255 characters for a simple text key and 20 to 432 characters for a cipher text key.

life-time.description: Authentication lifetime. During the authentication lifetime, RSVP authentication lifetime will be reset after a RSVP packet is received. If no RSVP packet is received when the authentication lifetime times out, the RSVP neighbor will delete the authentication relationship to prevent persistent authentication.

handshake-enable.description: Enable/disable the handshake authentication. When RSVP packet authentication is out of order, a handshake will be initiated and authentication will be re-negotiated.

window-size.description: Size of an authentication window that is set to prevent information loss caused by packet disorder. If the packet sequence number exceeds the window size, the packet is considered to be out of order.

os-group-name.description: Name of RSVP distributed instance os-group.

bfd-all-interfaces.description: Configure BFD for all interfaces parameters.

enable.description: Enable/disable the enabling state of bfd for all interfaces capability.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval for sending BFD packets for all interfaces.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval for receiving BFD packets for all interfaces.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing global MPLS TE BFD for all interfaces packets.

tos-exp.description: Configure the priority of the global BFD session packet.

preferred-igp.description: Preferred IGP TEDB in CSPF to calculate path.

multi-instances-short-path-mode.description: Multiple IGP instances shortest path Mode.

tie-breaking.description:
Rules for selecting multiple equal-cost routes. In path computation, if multiple paths meet constraints, a device uses this rule to select a path.
Random: randomly selects a path.
Least Fill: selects a link with the lowest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.
Most Fill: selects a link with the highest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options IGP and TE, default is TE.

srlg-path-calculate-mode.description:
SRLG path calculation mode. It is configured on the ingress of a tunnel so that a TE HSB path can be calculated based on the SRLG if TE HSB is enabled.
In strict mode, the ingress keeps using the SRLG as a constraint. In preferred mode, SRLG will be considered as a constraint only when the ingress computes a backup CR-LSP at the first time. If the path computation fails, the ingress will no longer uses the SRLG as a constraint.

tedbs.description: List of TEDB records of MPLS-TE.

tedb.description: Statistics of TEDB record of MPLS-TE.

process-id.description: Process ID of the IGP protocol.

area-id.description: ID of the area where the node resides.

link-count.description: Number of TE interfaces of the node.

srdbs.description: List of SRDB records of MPLS-TE.

srdb.description: Statistics of SRDB record of MPLS-TE.

explicit-path-name.description: Explicit path name of a leaflist. The name is case-insensitive.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a P2MP Template setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The setup priority must be equal to or smaller than its holding priority.

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a P2MP Template holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The holding priority must be equal to or larger than its setup priority.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization of P2MP Template.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a P2MP Template with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

hop-limit.description: Hop limit on a TE LSP.

include-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (includeAny).

exclude-any.description: Administrative group attribute of a LSP (excludeAny).

setup-priority.description:
Setup priority of FRR-protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel setup priority cannot exceed the setup priority of the active tunnel.

hold-priority.description:
Holding priority of FRR protection tunnels. The smaller the value, the higher the priority. The value 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The protection tunnel holding priority cannot exceed the active tunnel holding priority.

min-rx-interval.description: BFD receiving interval.

record-route.description: Route record mode. The available options are not record, recording routes only, and recording routes and labels.

resv-style.description: P2P Template reservation styles. SE style: shared explicit style; FF: fixed filter style. The default tunnel reservation style is SE.

setup-priority.description:
Specifies a P2P Template setup priority. The smaller the value, the higher the setup priority. 0 is the highest priority.
Special explanation:

hold-priority.description:
Specifies a P2P Template holding priority. The smaller the value, the higher the holding priority. 0 is the highest priority.

reoptimization.description: Enable/disable auto reoptimization enabling state of P2P Template.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options are DEFAULT, IGP and TE, default is inheriting from global configuration.

tie-breaking.description: Routing rules for a P2P Template with multiple equal-cost routes. Random: Select a link randomly. Least fill: Select the link with smallest bandwidth usage. Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

auto-bandwidth-threshold.description: Set the threshold of the adjustment bandwidth.

auto-bandwidth-threshold-absolute.description: Set the absolute minimum bandwidth of the adjustment bandwidth.

hotstandby-enable.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

hotstandby-wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

hotstandby-path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

frr.description: Configure fast reroute attribute of P2P Template.

bandwidth-protection-enable.description: Enable/disable the tunnel with fast reroute capability requests bandwidth protection.

hold-priority.description:

If a NE does not receive a response from the peer end after sending a message to the peer end, the NE will start the retransmission mechanism. The retransmission interval increases with the increase of the retransmission incremental value. The formula is as following: retransmission interval = last retransmission interval * (1 + retransmission incremental value).

challenge-retransmission-interval.description: Challenge message retransmission interval. If the NE does not receive a response message from the peer end after sending a Challenge message for handshake authentication to the peer end, the NE will retransmit the Challenge message.

max-challenge-miss-times.description: Maximum challenge loss times. If the times of a retransmitting a Challenge message from the NE to its neighbor exceed the maximum challenge loss times, the NE considers that the handshake cannot be established and will not send a Challenge message again.

is-send-down-reason.description: Enable/disable RSVP send down reason capability. When this command is configured on a non-ingress node, RSVP can send the down reasons to the ingress through PATH ERROR message and RESV TEAR message.

transit-rro1.description:
Transit-rro1.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value cannot be set to disable for transit-rro1. If transit-rro1 is configured, one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type can only be selected form transit RRO types. The transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

transit-rro2.description:
Transit-rro2.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The value if disable type can be disable. For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. If transit-rro2 is configured, this leaf can be set to disable. Or one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type form transit RRO types can only be selected for transit-rro2 node, and the transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

transit-rro3.description:
Transit-rro3.
Special explanation:
Constraint: The value if disable type can be disable. For transit RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the outbound interface type can be outgoing or outgoing-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. If transit-rro2 is set to disable, transit-rro3 can only be set to disable, too. Or one of the inbound interface type, outbound interface type, and Router ID type can only be selected for transit-rro3 node form transit RRO types, and the transit RRO type of transit-rro1, transit-rro2, and transit-rro3 nodes must be different from one another.

egress-rro1.description:
Egress-rro1.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For egress RRO types: For egress RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value if disable type can be disable. The value cannot be set to disable for egress-rro1. If egress-rro1 is delivered, either the inbound interface type or Router ID type can be selected form egress RRO types. The egress RRO type of egress-rro1 must be differ from that of egress-rro2.

egress-rro2.description:
Egress-rro2.
Special explanation:
Constraint: For egress RRO types: The value of the inbound interface type can be incoming or incoming-with-label. The value of the Router ID type can be router-id or router-id-with-label. The value if disable type can be disable. If egress-rro2 is configured, this leaf can be set to disable. Or either the inbound interface type or Router ID type can be selected form egress RRO types, and the egress RRO type of egress-rro1 must be differ from that of egress-rro2.

keychain-name.description: Keychain name. The name is case insensitive.

md5-password.description: Authentication key of a RSVP TE neighbor. The two NEs that configured with neighbor authentication authenticate each other by sending and receiving RSVP packets. The packets that are sent from the local NE to its neighbor carry the authentication information that are calculated based on the authentication key by using the MD5 algorithm. The packets received from the neighbor are also authenticated based on the authentication key. The password is a string ranging from 1 to 255 characters for a simple text key and 20 to 432 characters for a cipher text key.

life-time.description: Authentication lifetime. During the authentication lifetime, RSVP authentication lifetime will be reset after a RSVP packet is received. If no RSVP packet is received when the authentication lifetime times out, the RSVP neighbor will delete the authentication relationship to prevent persistent authentication.

handshake-enable.description: Enable/disable the handshake authentication. When RSVP packet authentication is out of order, a handshake will be initiated and authentication will be re-negotiated.

window-size.description: Size of an authentication window that is set to prevent information loss caused by packet disorder. If the packet sequence number exceeds the window size, the packet is considered to be out of order.

tie-breaking.description:
Rules for selecting multiple equal-cost routes. In path computation, if multiple paths meet constraints, a device uses this rule to select a path.
Random: randomly selects a path.
Least Fill: selects a link with the lowest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.
Most Fill: selects a link with the highest proportion of used bandwidth to the maximum reservable bandwidth.

path-metric-type.description: Referenced metric type of one link for calculating path when creating TE tunnels. The available options IGP and TE, default is TE.

srlg-path-calculate-mode.description:
SRLG path calculation mode. It is configured on the ingress of a tunnel so that a TE HSB path can be calculated based on the SRLG if TE HSB is enabled.
In strict mode, the ingress keeps using the SRLG as a constraint. In preferred mode, SRLG will be considered as a constraint only when the ingress computes a backup CR-LSP at the first time. If the path computation fails, the ingress will no longer uses the SRLG as a constraint.

Most fill: Select the link with biggest bandwidth usage. By default, routing rules are inherited from the global MPLS TE routing rules. If multiple paths meet certain limits, a path will be selected based on the preceding rules.

auto-bandwidth-threshold.description: Set the threshold of the adjustment bandwidth.

hotstandby-enable.description: Enable/disable hot standby for protecting TE tunnels. When an active LSP is set up successfully, a standby LSP that meets certain limits will be set up to protect the active LSP. When the active LSP fails, the traffic on the active LSP will be switched to the standby LSP.

hotstandby-wtr.description: Time of waiting recovering back to primary LSP. When hot-standby backup is in use, after primary LSP restores, the traffic will switch to primary LSP after waiting some time instead of switching to primary LSP immediately. This is to avoid frequent switching between primary LSP and backup LSP caused by network flapping.

hotstandby-path-overlap.description: Enable/disable hot-standby LSP can overlap primary LSP. If there is no other path to choose, the hot-standby LSP can overlap the primary LSP.

enable.description:
Enable/disable capability of global MPLS TE BFD detection.
Special explanation:
Constraint: This capability depends on the configuration of global bfd.

mode.description:
BFD detect mode.
Special explanation:
In one-arm BFD, the configured min-tx-interval does not take effect.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval for sending Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval for receiving Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing Global MPLS TE BFD packets.

bfd-for-tunnel_schema.description: Configure global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel.

mode.description:
BFD detect mode.
Special explanation:
In one-arm BFD, the configured min-tx-interval does not take effect.
Once mode one-arm-echo is configured, BFD for tunnel is enabled.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are received.

detect-multiplier.description: Maximum number of times for losing global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel packets.

bfd-sessions_schema.description: List of statistics all dynamic BFD sessions for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

bfd-session.description: Statistics of a dynamic BFD session for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

outgoing-interface-name.description: Outgoing interface name of the tunnel.

lsp-index.description: LSP index of the BFD session.

signal-protocol.description: Signal protocol type of the tunnel.

min-tx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are sent.

min-rx-interval.description: Interval at which packets of global MPLS TE BFD for tunnel are received.

bfd-state.description: Status of dynamic BFD for RSVP-TE or SR-MPLS TE.

session-age.description: Time elapsed since a BFD session was established.

lsp-index.description: LSP index of the BFD session.

tunnel-management_schema.description: Tunnel management, including management on tunnel policies.

tunnel-policys.description: List of global tunnel policy configurations. A tunnel policy can be used to specify a rule for selecting tunnels.

tunnel-policy.description: Configure a global tunnel policy, which is used to specify rules for selecting tunnels.

name.description: Name of a tunnel policy. The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

select-sequences.description: List of tunnel select sequences configurations.

select-sequence.description: Enable/disable the selection of different types of tunnels. If the value is INVALID, no tunnel type is configured.

loadbalance.description: Specify the maximum number of tunnels for load balancing. The maximum value varies according to hardware. To query the value, you can perform a get operation.

select-tunnel-types.description: List of different types of tunnels that are selected in order of priority.

type.description: The selected sequence type. CR-LSP is mutually exclusive with TE and SR-TE. LSP is mutually exclusive with BGP, LDP, and SRBE-LSP.

nexthops.description: List of rules for binding TE tunnels to destination addresses, so that VPN traffic destined for each destination address can be transmitted over the bound TE tunnels.

nexthop.description: Configure a rule for binding tunnels to a specified destination address.

address.description: Destination IP address to be bound to a tunnel.

down-switch.description: Enable/disable tunnel switching. After this option is selected, if the bound TE tunnel is unavailable, the system will select an available tunnel in order of conventional LSP, CR-LSP, and Local_IFNET tunnel.

ignore-destination-check.description: Enable/disable the function of checking whether the destination address of a TE tunnel matches the destination address specified in a tunnel policy.

include-ldp.description: Enable/disable load balancing among tunnels that include LDP LSPs.

select-sequences.description: List of tunnel select sequences configurations.

select-sequence.description: Enable/disable the selection of different types of tunnels. If the value is INVALID, no tunnel type is configured.

loadbalance.description: Specify the maximum number of tunnels for load balancing. The maximum value varies according to hardware. To query the value, you can perform a get operation.

select-tunnel-types.description: List of different types of tunnels that are selected in order of priority.

tunnel-down-switch.description: Configure traffic switching to a tunnel that is selected in the LSP > TE > GRE order of priority if a destination address is not bound to any tunnel.

enable.description: Enable/disable traffic switching to a tunnel that is selected in the LSP > TE > GRE order of priority if a destination address is not bound to any tunnel.

tunnel-info.description: Operational state of tunnels managed, such as their tunnel IDs, tunnel types, and destination IP addresses.

destination.description: Destination IP address of a tunnel.

sr-te-policy-color.description: Tunnel color. The node sr-te-policy-color is obsolete. You are advised to use the node color-type.

items.description: Operational data of tunnel color.

color-prioritys.description: List of SD-WAN tunnel color information.

color-priority.description: Operational state of SD-WAN tunnel color information.

subscribe-tunnel-policys.description: List of tunnel policy reference times.

subscribe-tunnel-policy.description: Statistics of the number of times that a tunnel policy has been referenced.

policy-name.description: Tunnel policy name. The value is a string of case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

policy-exist.description: Whether a tunnel policy has been configured.

count.description: Number of times a tunnel policy is referenced.
